name: Extending Knockout.js Session From ThatConference - Knock Me Out
caption: www.knockmeout.net
description: I had a wonderful time at ThatConference this week. It was really special to be in a place with so many people that are passionate about the same …

data.message: You should do one Tayseer and record it :)
I'm studying different MV* JS frameworks these days. I'm more concerned about simplicity than performance.
so what is your best favorite one till now ?

The default templating engine in Knockout has some perofmrnace issues yeah (but that's pluggable/replaceable), as well as, like everything else, you can shoot yourself in the foot with it (too many updates to UI etc, many things that are already addressed and have solutions, but those who don't know, don't use them).
Also, knockout is the best in terms of browser compatibility. Which is important for some projects that care about older IE.

There is no favorite till now. Each one has advantages & disadvantages.

Knockout: data binding
Backbone: routers, Local storage & remote storage

I'm reading also about Angular & Ember. There are many others but they are not popular the the 4 I mentioned. Beside this, all of these frameworks have plugins, which I should take into considerations.

One day I will publish a comparison between these frameworks.
cool, waiting for that Mohammad Tayseer
